availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Missouri native. Married to Pamela Dodge Beattie. Father of Thomas J. Beattie, James W. Beattie, Henry Beattie, and Elizabeth Beattie. Practiced in partnership with William S. Bodley and Alexander Casseday. Judge Advocate of the Kentucky State Guard.

bibl.p: Tannerâ€™s Louisville Directory, and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Henry Tanner, 1861), 36, 344. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Fifth Ward, p. 62. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Sixth Ward, p. 95. Find A Grave, "James A. Beattie (1833-1893)," Memorial #100676088, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=100676088&ref=acom (accessed July, 11, 2017).
